s.text: A US purchase of the island from Spain had long been on the agenda, even though Mart’ had warned of becoming a satellite of the United States (ÒI know the Monster, because I have lived in its lair,Ó he wrote).
After 1933 Fulgencio Batista, though only a sergeant, orchestrated the strings of power through a series of puppet presidents before winning the presidency outright in 1940.
But nearly four decades after the Cuban missile crisis, the world continues to wait, wondering whether a lifting of US trade and tourism sanctions or a change in leadership in Cuba will arrive first.
More than 30,000 Cubans tried to cross shark-infested waters to Florida on improvised rafts.
At the same time, the new government instituted sweeping, enlightened programs to eradicate illiteracy and provide free universal schooling and health care.
The media were soon placed under state control, promised elections were never held, and Committees for the Defense of the Revolution (CDRs) were established to keep tabs on dissenters.
Expatriate Cubans settled in nearby Florida, establishing a colony that would steadily gain in political and economic power.
Expatriate Cubans settled in nearby Florida, establishing a colony that would steadily gain in political and economic power.

Though settlers brought the first African slaves to Cuba in the early 1500s, hundreds of thousands of African laborers were imported in the late 18th century to meet the demands of the sugar industry.
